forum.content:
HI all,
First thanks to all of you who help me learn English before. However, I have a question about setence structure when I listened to English magazine. So please help me again, thanks.

the setence:
"I ask him how different his life would have been had he been exposed to a gruop like SAY as a kid."

I am confused by the structure of above setence. Since there should be one verb, I think "ask" us that one. As the result, the follows "how...kid" is a clause. But I am familiar with this style of structure.

is it interpreted by the following way: [how different his life would have been] [had] [he been......]

had 是使役動詞，拿來修飾後面的句子(目前看起來比較像這樣)，還是作為倒裝句來使用(是說我也不知道這邊為什麼能用倒裝句，因為前面有點與事實不符？)

但如果had是使役動詞，後面應該要接原型be吧？所以看起來比較像倒裝句？

Anyway, I am completely confused by this setence. Anyone who knew this please tell me, thanks.

Polo
forum.title: question about setence structure
